sites.name: Vatican Museums
sites.description: A world-renowned museum complex showcasing an extensive collection of art, including the Sistine Chapel and Raphael's Rooms.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded on weekdays and during off-peak seasons.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets online in advance to skip long queues.

sites.name: Galleria Borghese
sites.description: A stunning art gallery set in the Borghese Gardens, featuring masterpieces by Bernini, Caravaggio, and Titian.
sites.seasonal_notes: Timed entry required; quieter during early hours.
sites.booking_tips: Reservations are essential; book well in advance.

sites.name: Castel Sant'Angelo
sites.description: A towering fortress originally built as a mausoleum and later used by popes and emperors, offering panoramic views of Rome.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded early in the day; check for seasonal exhibits.
sites.booking_tips: Buy tickets online to avoid long queues.

sites.name: Tiber River Walk
sites.description: A scenic walk along the Tiber River with views of historic bridges and ancient architecture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful in all seasons; evening walks reveal the city’s illuminated landmarks.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed for a walk; boat tours can be reserved online for discounts.

sites.name: Piazza Navona
sites.description: A charming Baroque square featuring magnificent fountains, street artists, and lively outdoor cafés.
sites.seasonal_notes: Busy year-round with tourists and local events.
sites.booking_tips: No ticket required; visit early for a quieter experience.

sites.name: Trastevere District
sites.description: A historic and bohemian area known for its narrow cobbled streets, vibrant nightlife, and authentic Roman eateries.
sites.seasonal_notes: Ideal for leisurely strolls in any season; lively in the evenings.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; best explored on foot.

sites.name: Villa Borghese Gardens
sites.description: Rome's largest public park offering beautiful gardens, lakes, and cultural attractions.
sites.seasonal_notes: Lush in spring and summer; quieter in winter.
sites.booking_tips: No reservation needed; consider renting a bike or a rowboat.

sites.name: Rome Craft Brewery Tour
sites.description: An interactive tour showcasing Rome's emerging craft beer scene with tastings and behind-the-scenes insights.
sites.seasonal_notes: Popular with locals and tourists; weekends may be busier.
sites.booking_tips: Pre-book tickets online to secure your spot.

sites.name: Giardino degli Aranci
sites.description: A serene garden on Aventine Hill offering panoramic views of Rome’s skyline and the Tiber Valley.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best on clear days for unobstructed views; sunset is particularly stunning.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early to secure a good spot.

sites.name: Campo de' Fiori
sites.description: A bustling square that transforms from a lively market by day to a vibrant social hub by night.
sites.seasonal_notes: Busy in the morning with market vendors; lively in the evenings.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; enjoy the local food stalls and outdoor dining.

sites.name: Palazzo Altemps
sites.description: A museum housing an impressive collection of classical sculptures in a Renaissance palace setting.
sites.seasonal_notes: Quieter on weekday mornings; part of the National Roman Museum.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online for guided tours.

sites.name: Explora – Children's Museum of Rome
sites.description: An interactive museum designed for children, offering hands-on exhibits and engaging learning experiences.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited on weekdays to avoid school groups.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets available online; check for family packages.

sites.name: Orto Botanico di Roma
sites.description: A tranquil botanical garden showcasing a diverse collection of plant species and lush landscapes.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best in spring when flowers are in full bloom; quieter on weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours are available on select days.

sites.name: Ostia Antica
sites.description: An extensive archaeological site that offers a glimpse into ancient Roman life through well-preserved ruins.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded early in the day; ideal for exploring on foot.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; consider joining a guided tour for deeper insights.

sites.name: Quirinal Palace
sites.description: The official residence of the President of Italy, featuring opulent interiors and historical artifacts.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; check for temporary closures due to official events.
sites.booking_tips: Book guided tours in advance where available.

sites.name: Mercato Testaccio
sites.description: A bustling local market offering fresh produce, gourmet street food, and traditional Roman specialties.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in the morning when stalls are freshly stocked; quieter on weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; bring cash for small purchases.

sites.name: Open Baladin Roma
sites.description: A popular craft beer bar featuring a wide selection of Italian and international brews in a relaxed setting.
sites.seasonal_notes: Outdoor seating available in summer; vibrant atmosphere year-round.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; check for special tasting events.

sites.name: Via del Corso
sites.description: A bustling shopping street lined with boutiques, international brands, and charming cafés.
sites.seasonal_notes: Ideal for leisurely shopping in all seasons; may be crowded during weekends.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; explore at your own pace.
